Package kut

Class Time

java.lang.Object
kut.Time
public class Time extends Object
Manangement of dates and time.

'time' is respresented by milliseconds, since the epoch (1970-01-01T00:00:00Z) NOTE:

Time values roll in functions fromXXX and mk. For example:

    Time.eqDay(Time.fromStr("20020534"), Time.fromStr("20020603")) -> 'true'
    Time.eqDay(Time.mk(34, 5, 2002), Time.mk(3, 6, 2002)) -> 'true'

  • Method Details

    • addDays

      public static long addDays(long tm, int days)
      Returns a new Time adding tm + days.

      NOTE: For add milliseconds use directly 'tm + days" (Example: 'tm + 234').

      Parameters:
      tm - Time
      days - Days to add (It can be a negative number).
      Returns:
      A new time.

    • day

      public static int day(long tm)
      Returns tm day.
      Parameters:
      tm - Time.
      Returns:
      Value between 1 and end of month (both inclusive).

      tm2 - Time.
      Returns:
      'true' if tm1 and tm2 are in the same day.

    • fmt

      public static String fmt(long tm, String template)
      Returns a string representation of 'tm'. Template uses the folowing variables to do substitution:
         %d  Day in number 06 -> 6.
   %D  Day with two digits 06 -> 06.
   %m  Month in number 03 -> 3.
   %M  Month with two digits 03 -> 03.
   %y  Year with two digits 2010 -> 10.
   %Y  Year with four digits 2010 -> 2010.
   %t  Time without milliseconds -> 15:03:55.
   %T  Time with milliseconds -> 15:03:55.345.
   %%  The sign '%'.
      Parameters:
      template - Template.
      tm - Time.
      Returns:
      String.
